meanings.definition: Tiny fibers or threads that accumulate on clothing or fabric.
meanings.sent1: I noticed some lints on my sweater after doing laundry.
meanings.sent2: She carefully removed the lints from her favorite jacket.
meanings.sent3: The lints on his shirt made it look like he had a fuzzy pet.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with floating lints, like tiny clouds.
meanings.sent5: The lints on the black pants stood out against the dark fabric.

meanings.definition: To remove lint from clothing or fabric.
meanings.sent1: Mom always lints the clothes before putting them in the dryer.
meanings.sent2: He lints his coat before going out to make sure he looks neat.
meanings.sent3: She lintsed the sweater so thoroughly that it looked brand new.
meanings.sent4: The dry cleaner lintsed the suit, making it pristine for the event.
meanings.sent5: Lintsing the curtains made them look fresh and clean again.

meanings.definition: A small piece of material used to stop bleeding or protect a wound.
meanings.sent1: The nurse applied a lint to the cut on his finger.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps a few lints in her first aid kit for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly called the lint on his knee a tiny superhero cape.
meanings.sent4: The doctor placed a lint on the wound before bandaging it up.
meanings.sent5: The soft lint provided comfort as it covered the injury.
